name: Ballads of Reemus: When the Bed Bites
description: Reemus the insect exterminator and his companion Liam the bear match wits with giant talking ants, termites and bed bugs in hopes of impressing the citizens of Fredricus once and for all! A fully voice-acted, funny, cartoon point and click adventure with animated cutscenes, side quests and more.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or newer Processor: 1GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 128MB graphics memory DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 100 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Pro:  - well-drawn and remarkable art design. - good voice acting. - some funny moments / dialogues, jokes never feel forced. - puzzles are easy to solve and straight-forward. Good for people with little experience in adventures. - reappearances of known characters (if you played Several Journeys of Reemus) - Mini-'Sidequests' (clicking on pieces of something scattered around and then putting them together)  Con:  - no hot-spot feature, which could be useful since some items can be kinda difficult to see. - It's short. Took me about 2,5 hours to beat it. - while the voice cast itself is pretty good, the quality of their voices could've been better.   If you are interested in this game, I would recommend you to play the 'The Several Journeys of Reemus' first. These are free flashgames which you can find on many websites, e.g.  www.clickshakegames.com  or  www.kongregate.com . They give you a pretty good impression how Ballads of Reemus works. If you find yourself enjoy it or are already a fan of the series (like I am): Grab it, it's definitely worth the money. I'm really looking forward to Ballads of Reemus 2 now. :)

Great Game. just the way point&click games should be, The World needs more games like this; Bizare fantasy, humour, voice acting, music, well and stylish art. True its short, but short and sweet, with optional hidden object/scavenger hunts to find puzzle pieces. and a really nice spot the difference interface. I quite liked that bit. Being a Discworld fan of old; Comedy, Art, and Voice Acting are what I look for in a point and click puzzle adventure game and the Ballad of Reemus did not disappoint. Exactly the kind of game I look for and I look forward to the Second Ballad of Reemus. Now I go to seek out the Journey of Reemus to learn the Origin of this Mighty Bard.
